verses.verse: Thus saith <S%H559><s%> <S%H8804><s%> the YY <S%H3068><s%>, Where is the bill <S%H5612><s%> of your mother's <S%H517><s%> divorcement <S%H3748><s%>, whom I have put away <S%H7971><s%> <S%H8765><s%>? or which of my creditors <S%H5383><s%> <S%H8802><s%> is it to whom I have sold <S%H4376><s%> <S%H8804><s%> you? Behold, for your iniquities <S%H5771><s%> have ye sold <S%H4376><s%> <S%H8738><s%> yourselves, and for your transgressions <S%H6588><s%> is your mother <S%H517><s%> put away <S%H7971><s%> <S%H8795><s%>.

Wherefore, when I came <S%H935><s%> <S%H8804><s%>, was there no man <S%H376><s%>? when I called <S%H7121><s%> <S%H8804><s%>, was there none to answer <S%H6030><s%> <S%H8802><s%>? Is my hand <S%H3027><s%> shortened <S%H7114><s%> <S%H8804><s%> at all <S%H7114><s%> <S%H8800><s%>, that it cannot redeem <S%H6304><s%>? or have I no power <S%H3581><s%> to deliver <S%H5337><s%> <S%H8687><s%>? behold, at my rebuke <S%H1606><s%> I dry up <S%H2717><s%> <S%H8686><s%> the sea <S%H3220><s%>, I make <S%H7760><s%> <S%H8799><s%> the rivers <S%H5104><s%> a wilderness <S%H4057><s%>: their fish <S%H1710><s%> stinketh <S%H887><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, because there is no water <S%H4325><s%>, and dieth <S%H4191><s%> <S%H8799><s%> for thirst <S%H6772><s%>.
I clothe <S%H3847><s%> <S%H8686><s%> the heavens <S%H8064><s%> with blackness <S%H6940><s%>, and I make <S%H7760><s%> <S%H8799><s%> sackcloth <S%H8242><s%> their covering <S%H3682><s%>.

The YY <S%H136><s%> GOD <S%H3069><s%> hath given <S%H5414><s%> <S%H8804><s%> me the tongue <S%H3956><s%> of the learned <S%H3928><s%>, that I should know <S%H3045><s%> <S%H8800><s%> how to speak <S%H5790><s%> <S%H8800><s%> a word <S%H1697><s%> in season to him that is weary <S%H3287><s%>: he wakeneth <S%H5782><s%> <S%H8686><s%> morning <S%H1242><s%> by morning <S%H1242><s%>, he wakeneth <S%H5782><s%> <S%H8686><s%> mine ear <S%H241><s%> to hear <S%H8085><s%> <S%H8800><s%> as the learned <S%H3928><s%>.

The YY <S%H136><s%> GOD <S%H3069><s%> hath opened <S%H6605><s%> <S%H8804><s%> mine ear <S%H241><s%>, and I was not rebellious <S%H4784><s%> <S%H8804><s%>, neither turned away <S%H5472><s%> <S%H8738><s%> back <S%H268><s%>.

I gave <S%H5414><s%> <S%H8804><s%> my back <S%H1460><s%> to the smiters <S%H5221><s%> <S%H8688><s%>, and my cheeks <S%H3895><s%> to them that plucked off <S%H4803><s%> <S%H8802><s%> the hair: I hid <S%H5641><s%> <S%H8689><s%> not my face <S%H6440><s%> from shame <S%H3639><s%> and spitting <S%H7536><s%>.

For the YY <S%H136><s%> GOD <S%H3069><s%> will help <S%H5826><s%> <S%H8799><s%> me; therefore shall I not be confounded <S%H3637><s%> <S%H8738><s%>: therefore have I set <S%H7760><s%> <S%H8804><s%> my face <S%H6440><s%> like a flint <S%H2496><s%>, and I know <S%H3045><s%> <S%H8799><s%> that I shall not be ashamed <S%H954><s%> <S%H8799><s%>.

He is near <S%H7138><s%> that justifieth <S%H6663><s%> <S%H8688><s%> me; who will contend <S%H7378><s%> <S%H8799><s%> with me? let us stand <S%H5975><s%> <S%H8799><s%> together <S%H3162><s%>: who is mine adversary <S%H1167><s%> <S%H4941><s%>? let him come near <S%H5066><s%> <S%H8799><s%> to me.

Behold, the YY <S%H136><s%> GOD <S%H3069><s%> will help <S%H5826><s%> <S%H8799><s%> me; who is he that shall condemn <S%H7561><s%> <S%H8686><s%> me? lo, they all shall wax old <S%H1086><s%> <S%H8799><s%> as a garment <S%H899><s%>; the moth <S%H6211><s%> shall eat them up <S%H398><s%> <S%H8799><s%>.

Who is among you that feareth <S%H3373><s%> the YY <S%H3068><s%>, that obeyeth <S%H8085><s%> <S%H8802><s%> the voice <S%H6963><s%> of his servant <S%H5650><s%>, that walketh <S%H1980><s%> <S%H8804><s%> in darkness <S%H2825><s%>, and hath no light <S%H5051><s%>? let him trust <S%H982><s%> <S%H8799><s%> in the name <S%H8034><s%> of the YY <S%H3068><s%>, and stay <S%H8172><s%> <S%H8735><s%> upon his 'Elohim <S%H430><s%>.

Behold, all ye that kindle <S%H6919><s%> <S%H8802><s%> a fire <S%H784><s%>, that compass yourselves about <S%H247><s%> <S%H8764><s%> with sparks <S%H2131><s%>: walk <S%H3212><s%> <S%H8798><s%> in the light <S%H217><s%> of your fire <S%H784><s%>, and in the sparks <S%H2131><s%> that ye have kindled <S%H1197><s%> <S%H8765><s%>. This shall ye have of mine hand <S%H3027><s%>; ye shall lie down <S%H7901><s%> <S%H8799><s%> in sorrow <S%H4620><s%>.
